lines.text:
[to Jimmy]
... If you're going to insist on being a jackass, I'm going to turn your case over to a veterinary.

Honey, why don't you get wise to yourself? This town's full of men who'd go goofy over you if you'd let 'em; so let 'em! Oh, don't take 'em too seriously; just kid 'em along and get what you can out of 'em. Say, if I had your looks I'd wear ermine underwear.
Well, maybe you would, Dixie, but I'm not the type.
You're telling me that after the way Humphries's been givin' you the eye the last three weeks?
Now you're imagining things.
So's Humphries.
I've answered ads for everything from a waitress to a lady's maid, and it's always the same old story - ten girls for every job.
My trouble's just the opposite - ten jobs and only one Dixie Dare!

[at a nightclub bar, introductions are being made]
Miss Dare, Mr. Goodrich.

[tipsily]
Hello, baby!
Dixie, Mr. Goodrich wants to dance with you.
[Dixie starts to protest]
No, no look here - that's not fat around his middle; that's the belt he carries his money in.

[brightening]
Oh, well then maybe he needs me.
[Dragging Mr. Goodrich onto the dance floor]
I'd just *love* to dance with you!

[befuddled]
Who said I wanted to dance?
Oh, but you will!
[Goodrich continues to protest as Dixie firmly guides him onto the floor]

[alone with Marion at last]
Now look here, I have to resort to bribery to get a moment alone with you!
